[![Image 22](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Commons-logo.svg) Media related to [2022 FIFA World Cup](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:2022_FIFA_World_Cup "commons:Category:2022 FIFA World Cup") at Wikimedia Commons

The **2022 FIFA World Cup** was the 22nd [FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup "FIFA World Cup"), the quadrennial world championship for national [football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Football "Football") teams organised by [FIFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA "FIFA"). It took place in [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar "Qatar") from 20 November to 18 December 2022, after the country was awarded the hosting rights in 2010. It was the first World Cup to be held in the [Middle East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_East "Middle East") and the [Arabian Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabian_Peninsula "Arabian Peninsula"), and the second in an Asian country after the [2002 tournament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup "2002 FIFA World Cup") in [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea") and [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan "Japan").[[A]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-2)

This tournament was the last with 32 participating teams, with the number of teams being increased to 48 for the [2026 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2026_FIFA_World_Cup "2026 FIFA World Cup"). To avoid the extremes of [Qatar's hot and humid climate in summers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geography_of_Qatar#Climate "Geography of Qatar"),[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto5-3) the event was held in November and December, becoming the first one to take place outside the traditional months of May, June, and July.[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto5-3)[[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-4) It was held over a reduced time frame of 29 days with 64 matches played in [eight venues](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#Stadiums) across [five cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#Cities). [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_national_football_team "Qatar national football team") entered the event—their first World Cup—automatically as the host's national team, alongside 31 teams determined by the [qualification process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification").

[Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") made history by becoming the first African nation to reach the semi-final of a World Cup, falling short 0–2 against [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team").[[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-5)[Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") were crowned the champions after winning [the final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2022 FIFA World Cup final") against the [title holder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2018 FIFA World Cup final")[France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") 4–2 on penalties following a 3–3 draw after extra time. It was Argentina's third title and their first since [1986](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup "1986 FIFA World Cup"). Argentina were the first nation from outside of Europe to win the tournament since [2002](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup "2002 FIFA World Cup"). French player [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") became the first player to score a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") in a World Cup final since [Geoff Hurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Hurst "Geoff Hurst") in the [1966 final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup "1966 FIFA World Cup") and won the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") as he scored the most goals (eight) during the tournament. Mbappé also became the first player to score in two consecutive finals since [Vavá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vav%C3%A1 "Vavá") of Brazil did the same in 1958 and 1962.

Argentine captain [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") was voted the tournament's best player, winning his second [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball"). The tournament has been considered exceptionally poetic as the capstone of his career, with the win fulfilling for some commentators a previously unmet criterion to be regarded as the greatest player of all time.[[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-NYT2022-6) Teammates [Emiliano Martínez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") and [Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") won the [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove"), awarded to the tournament's best [goalkeeper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goalkeeper_(association_football) "Goalkeeper (association football)"), and the [Young Player Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Young_Player_Award "FIFA World Cup Young Player Award"), awarded to the tournament's best young player, respectively. With 172 goals, the tournament set a record for the highest number of goals scored in the 32-team format, with every participating team scoring at least one goal.

The choice to host the World Cup in Qatar [attracted significant criticism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_controversies "2022 FIFA World Cup controversies"), with concerns raised over the country's [treatment of migrant workers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_controversies#Human_rights_concern "2022 FIFA World Cup controversies"), [women](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#LGBT_and_women's_rights), and [members of the LGBTQ+ community](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Qatar "LGBT rights in Qatar"), as well as Qatar's climate, [lack of a strong football culture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_controversies#Qatari_football_record "2022 FIFA World Cup controversies"), scheduling changes, and allegations of bribery for hosting rights and [wider FIFA corruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_corruption_case "2015 FIFA corruption case").[[B]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-15)

triples.statement: The 2022 FIFA World Cup, hosted by Qatar from November 20 to December 18, featured 32 teams and 64 matches. Argentina won its third title, defeating France in the final. Kylian Mbappé was the top scorer, and Lionel Messi was named the best player.

section_body: The [FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup "FIFA World Cup") is a professional football tournament held between national football teams, organised by [FIFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA "FIFA").[[14]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-16)[[15]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-17) The tournament, held every four years, was [first played in 1930](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1930_FIFA_World_Cup "1930 FIFA World Cup") in Uruguay,[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-foxsports.com-18) and has been contested by 32 teams since the [1998 event](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup "1998 FIFA World Cup").[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-foxsports.com-18) The tournament was contested with eight [round-robin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Round-robin_tournament "Round-robin tournament") groups followed by a [knockout round](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-elimination_tournament "Single-elimination tournament") for 16 teams.[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-19) The defending champions were [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team"), who defeated [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team") 4–2 in the [2018 FIFA World Cup Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "2018 FIFA World Cup Final").[[18]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-20)[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-21) The event was scheduled to take place under a reduced length,[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-22) from 20 November to 18 December in Qatar.[[21]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-23)[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto6-24)[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-25) Being held in Qatar, it was the first World Cup tournament to be held in the [Arab world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_world "Arab world").[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-26) Spectators were not required to follow most [COVID-19 restrictions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_restrictions "COVID-19 restrictions") such as social distancing, wearing masks, and negative tests.[[25]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-27)

triples.sentence: The event was scheduled to take place under a reduced length,[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-22) from 20 November to 18 December in Qatar.[[21]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-23)[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto6-24)[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-25)
triples.statement: The event was scheduled to take place in Qatar with a reduced length, from 20 November to 18 December.

triples.sentence: Spectators were not required to follow most [COVID-19 restrictions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_restrictions "COVID-19 restrictions") such as social distancing, wearing masks, and negative tests.[[25]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-27)
triples.statement: Spectators were not required to follow most COVID-19 restrictions, including social distancing, wearing masks, and negative tests.

section_body:
Unlike previous FIFA World Cups, which are typically played in June and July, because of [Qatar's intense summer heat and often fairly high humidity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geography_of_Qatar#Climate "Geography of Qatar"),[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto5-3)[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto6-24)[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-28) the 2022 World Cup was played in November and December.[[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Atlantic_2022-7)[[27]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-29) As a result, the World Cup was unusually staged in the middle of the seasons of many domestic association football leagues, which started in late July or August, including all of the major European leagues, which had been obliged to incorporate extended breaks into their domestic schedules to accommodate the World Cup. Major European competitions had scheduled their respective competitions group matches to be played before the World Cup, to avoid playing group matches the following year.[[28]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-30)

The match schedule was confirmed by FIFA on 15 July 2020.[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule_confirmed-31) The group stage was set to begin on 21 November, with four matches every day. Later, the schedule was tweaked by moving the Qatar vs Ecuador game to 20 November, after Qatar lobbied FIFA to allow their team to open the tournament.[[30]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-32)[[31]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-33)[[32]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-34) The final was played on 18 December 2022, [National Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Day_(Qatar) "National Day (Qatar)"), at [Lusail Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium").[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule_confirmed-31)[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) Unlike previous tournaments where the match venues and kick-off times for each fixture were set prior to the draw, the assignment of group fixtures for each matchday to a specific venue and kick-off time was only made after the final draw, with the teams of each specific fixture known. This was due to the close proximity of the venues, which allowed the organisers to optimise stadium allocation for spectators and kick-off times for television audiences.[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule_confirmed-31)

The matches for each group were allocated to the following stadiums:[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35)

*   Groups A, B, E, F: [Al Bayt Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Bayt_Stadium "Al Bayt Stadium"), [Khalifa International Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_International_Stadium "Khalifa International Stadium"), [Al Thumama Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Thumama_Stadium "Al Thumama Stadium"), [Ahmad bin Ali Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmad_bin_Ali_Stadium "Ahmad bin Ali Stadium")
*   Groups C, D, G, H: [Lusail Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium"), [Stadium 974](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stadium_974 "Stadium 974"), [Education City Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Education_City_Stadium "Education City Stadium"), [Al Janoub Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Janoub_Stadium "Al Janoub Stadium")

FIFA confirmed the group stage venue and kick-off times on 1 April 2022, following the draw.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-36)[[35]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-37)

triples.sentence: Later, the schedule was tweaked by moving the Qatar vs Ecuador game to 20 November, after Qatar lobbied FIFA to allow their team to open the tournament.[[30]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-32)[[31]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-33)[[32]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-34)
triples.statement: The schedule was later adjusted, moving the Qatar vs. Ecuador game to November 20 after Qatar lobbied FIFA to allow its team to open the tournament.

triples.sentence: The final was played on 18 December 2022, [National Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Day_(Qatar) "National Day (Qatar)"), at [Lusail Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium").[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule_confirmed-31)[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35)
triples.statement: The final was played at Lusail Stadium on December 18, 2022, which is Qatar's National Day.

triples.sentence: The matches for each group were allocated to the following stadiums:[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35)

FIFA confirmed the group stage venue and kick-off times on 1 April 2022, following the draw.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-36)[[35]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-37)
triples.statement: Following the draw, FIFA confirmed the group stage venues and kick-off times on April 1, 2022.

section_body:
In April 2022, FIFA announced the prizes for all participating nations. Each qualified team received $1.5 million before the competition to cover preparation costs with each team receiving at least $9 million in prize money. This edition's total prize pool was $440 million, $40 million greater than the prize pool of the [previous tournament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup").[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-38)

| Place | Teams | Amount (in millions) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Per team | Total |
| Champions | 1 | $42 | $42 |
| Runners-up | 1 | $30 | $30 |
| Third place | 1 | $27 | $27 |
| Fourth place | 1 | $25 | $25 |
| 5th–8th place (quarter-finals) | 4 | $17 | $68 |
| 9th–16th place (round of 16) | 8 | $13 | $104 |
| 17th–32nd place (group stage) | 16 | $9 | $144 |
| Total | 32 | $440 |

triples.sentence: This edition's total prize pool was $440 million, $40 million greater than the prize pool of the [previous tournament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup").[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-38)
triples.statement: The total prize pool for this edition was $440 million, an increase of $40 million from the previous tournament.

section_body:
Main articles: [2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cup bids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_and_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bids "2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cup bids") and [Qatar 2022 FIFA World Cup bid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bid "Qatar 2022 FIFA World Cup bid")

[![Image 23](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Rusia_entreg%C3%B3_el_relevo_de_la_antorcha_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_a_Qatar.jpg/250px-Rusia_entreg%C3%B3_el_relevo_de_la_antorcha_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_a_Qatar.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rusia_entreg%C3%B3_el_relevo_de_la_antorcha_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_a_Qatar.jpg)

Russian President [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Putin "Vladimir Putin") handing over the symbolic relay baton for the hosting rights of the 2022 FIFA World Cup to Qatar's Emir [Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamim_bin_Hamad_Al_Thani "Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani") in June 2018.

The [bidding procedure to host the 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cups](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_and_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bids "2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cup bids") began in January 2009. National associations had until 2 February 2009 to register interest.[[42]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-44) Initially, 11 bids were made for the [2018 FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup"), but Mexico withdrew from proceedings,[[43]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-45)[[44]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-46) and [Indonesia's bid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bid "Indonesia 2022 FIFA World Cup bid") was rejected by FIFA in February 2010 after the Indonesian Football Association failed to submit a letter of [Indonesian government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Indonesia "Government of Indonesia") guarantee to support the bid.[[45]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-reject-47)

After [UEFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA "UEFA") were guaranteed to host the 2018 event, members of UEFA were no longer in contention to host in 2022.[[46]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-48) There were five bids remaining for the 2022 FIFA World Cup: Australia, Japan, Qatar, South Korea, and the United States. The 22-member [FIFA Executive Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_Executive_Committee "FIFA Executive Committee") convened in [Zürich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z%C3%BCrich "Zürich"), Switzerland, on 2 December 2010 to vote to select the hosts of both tournaments.[[47]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-2018+2022_bids-49)[[48]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-50) Two FIFA executive committee members were suspended before the vote in relation to allegations of corruption regarding their votes.[[49]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-51) The decision to host the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, which was graded as having "high operational risk",[[50]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-52) generated criticism from media commentators.[[51]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-53) It was criticised by many as being part of the FIFA corruption scandals,[[52]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-54) which led to the [2015 FIFA corruption case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_corruption_case "2015 FIFA corruption case").

The voting patterns were as follows:[[53]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-55)

2022 FIFA bidding (majority 12 votes) | Bidders | Votes |
| --- | --- |
| Round 1 | Round 2 | Round 3 | Round 4 |
| **Qatar** | 11 | 10 | 11 | 14 |
| United States | 3 | 5 | 6 | 8 |
| South Korea | 4 | 5 | 5 | Eliminated |
| Japan | 3 | 2 | Eliminated |
| Australia | 1 | Eliminated |

triples.sentence: Initially, 11 bids were made for the [2018 FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup"), but Mexico withdrew from proceedings,[[43]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-45)[[44]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-46) and [Indonesia's bid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bid "Indonesia 2022 FIFA World Cup bid") was rejected by FIFA in February 2010 after the Indonesian Football Association failed to submit a letter of [Indonesian government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Indonesia "Government of Indonesia") guarantee to support the bid.[[45]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-reject-47)
triples.statement: Eleven bids were initially made for the 2018 World Cup, but Mexico withdrew, and Indonesia's bid was rejected in February 2010 due to a failure to provide a government guarantee.

triples.sentence: Two FIFA executive committee members were suspended before the vote in relation to allegations of corruption regarding their votes.[[49]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-51)
triples.statement: Before the vote, two members of the FIFA executive committee were suspended due to corruption allegations concerning their votes.

section_body:
Base camps were used by the 32 national squads to stay and train before and during the World Cup tournament. In July 2022, FIFA announced the hotels and training sites for each participating team.[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-86) This World Cup was the most compact since the inaugural edition [in 1930](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1930_FIFA_World_Cup "1930 FIFA World Cup"), with 24 of the 32 teams being within a 10 km radius of each other, and are concentrated within the [Doha Area](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doha_Metropolitan_Area "Doha Metropolitan Area"). It was the first Cup since 1930 in which players did not need to take flights to matches and could remain at the same training base throughout the entire tournament.[[85]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-campsa2-87)[[86]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-campsb2-88)

section_body: The Qatari government employed about 50,000 security personnel, including police departments and military forces. These personnel came from at least thirteen countries, including Poland, Germany, France, Kuwait, Jordan, Italy, Palestine, Spain, Pakistan (4,500 Army troops), Turkey (3,000 riot police personnel), USA, Saudi Arabia and the United Kingdom.[[87]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-EA2-89)[[88]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:9b2-90)[[89]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-91)

section_body:
*   [Saint Lucia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Lucia_national_football_team "Saint Lucia national football team") initially entered [CONCACAF qualification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_CONCACAF_first_round#Group_E "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF first round") but withdrew from it before their first match.
*   [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea_national_football_team "North Korea national football team") withdrew from the [AFC qualifying round](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_AFC_second_round#Group_H "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC second round") due to safety concerns related to the [COVID-19 pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Asia "COVID-19 pandemic in Asia").
*   Both [American Samoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Samoa_national_football_team "American Samoa national football team") and [Samoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa_national_football_team "Samoa national football team") withdrew before the [OFC qualification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(OFC) "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (OFC)") draw due to travel restrictions following the pandemic.[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-101)
*   [Tonga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonga_national_football_team "Tonga national football team") withdrew after the [2022 Hunga Tonga–Hunga Ha'apai eruption and tsunami](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Hunga_Tonga%E2%80%93Hunga_Ha%27apai_eruption_and_tsunami "2022 Hunga Tonga–Hunga Ha'apai eruption and tsunami").[[100]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-102)
*   Due to [COVID-19](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19 "COVID-19") outbreaks in their squads, [Vanuatu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanuatu_national_football_team "Vanuatu national football team") and [Cook Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cook_Islands_national_football_team "Cook Islands national football team") also withdrew because of the [travel restrictions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travel_during_the_COVID-19_pandemic "Travel during the COVID-19 pandemic").[[101]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-103)[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-104)
*   The previous World Cup hosts, [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia_national_football_team "Russia national football team"), were disqualified from competing due to the [Russian invasion of Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine "Russian invasion of Ukraine").[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-105)

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup squads](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_squads "2022 FIFA World Cup squads")

Before submitting their final squad for the tournament, teams named a provisional squad of up to 55 players. Teams were required to have their 55-player roster submitted to FIFA by 21 October.[[105]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-107) Teams were required to name their final squads by 13 November.[[106]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-108) In August 2022, FIFA increased the final squad size to 26 players from a total of 23 players at the [2018 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup").[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-109) All teams had a total of 26 players in their final squads except for [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") and [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran_national_football_team "Iran national football team"), who chose 25 players.[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-110)[[109]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-111)

triples.sentence: In August 2022, FIFA increased the final squad size to 26 players from a total of 23 players at the [2018 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup").[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-109)
triples.statement: In August 2022, FIFA increased the final squad size to 26 players, up from 23 players at the 2018 World Cup.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup seeding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_seeding "2022 FIFA World Cup seeding")

The final draw was held at the Doha Exhibition and Convention Center in [Doha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doha "Doha"), Qatar,[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-112) on 1 April 2022,[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-113) 19:00 [AST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabia_Standard_Time "Arabia Standard Time"), prior to the completion of [qualification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification"). The two winners of the [inter-confederation play-offs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(inter-confederation_play-offs) "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (inter-confederation play-offs)") and the winner of the [Path A of the UEFA play-offs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_UEFA_second_round#Path_A "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA second round") were not known at the time of the draw.[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-114) The draw was attended by 2,000 guests and was led by [Carli Lloyd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carli_Lloyd "Carli Lloyd"), [Jermaine Jenas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jermaine_Jenas "Jermaine Jenas") and sports broadcaster Samantha Johnson, assisted by the likes of [Cafu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cafu "Cafu") (Brazil), [Lothar Matthäus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lothar_Matth%C3%A4us "Lothar Matthäus") (Germany), [Adel Ahmed Malalla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adel_Ahmed_Malalla "Adel Ahmed Malalla") (Qatar), [Ali Daei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali_Daei "Ali Daei") (Iran), [Bora Milutinović](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bora_Milutinovi%C4%87 "Bora Milutinović") (Serbia/Mexico), [Jay-Jay Okocha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jay-Jay_Okocha "Jay-Jay Okocha") (Nigeria), [Rabah Madjer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabah_Madjer "Rabah Madjer") (Algeria), and [Tim Cahill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Cahill "Tim Cahill") (Australia).[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-drawProcedure-115)[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-116)

For the draw, 32 teams were allocated into four pots based on the [FIFA Men's World Rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_Men%27s_World_Rankings "FIFA Men's World Rankings") of 31 March 2022.[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-117) Pot 1 contained host Qatar (who were automatically assigned to position A1) and the best seven teams. Pot 2 contained the next best eight teams, with the next best eight teams into pot 3. Pot 4 contained the five lowest-ranked teams, along with the placeholders for the two inter-confederation play-off winners and the UEFA Path A play-off winner. Teams from the same confederation could not be drawn into the same group except for UEFA teams, for which there was at least one and no more than two per group.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto2-118)

This principle also applied to the placeholder teams, with constraints applying based on the confederation of both potential winners of each play-off tie. The draw started with pot 1 and ended with pot 4, with each team selected then allocated into the first available group alphabetically. The position for the team within the group would then be drawn (for the purpose of the [match schedule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#Schedule)), with the pot 1 teams automatically drawn into position 1 of each group.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto2-118) The pots for the draw are shown below.[[117]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-needtoknow-119)

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup officials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_officials "2022 FIFA World Cup officials")

In May 2022, FIFA announced the list of 36 referees, 69 assistant referees, and 24 [video assistant referees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_assistant_referee "Video assistant referee") for the tournament. Of the 36 referees, FIFA included two each from Argentina, Brazil, England, and France.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-124)[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-125)

For the first time women referees officiated games at a major men's tournament.[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-126) France's [Stéphanie Frappart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St%C3%A9phanie_Frappart "Stéphanie Frappart"), [Salima Mukansanga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salima_Mukansanga "Salima Mukansanga") from Rwanda, and [Yoshimi Yamashita](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshimi_Yamashita "Yoshimi Yamashita") from Japan became the first female referees to be appointed to a men's World Cup.[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-127) Frappart previously oversaw the [2019 FIFA Women's World Cup Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_FIFA_Women%27s_World_Cup_Final "2019 FIFA Women's World Cup Final").[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-128) They were joined by three female assistant referees, Neuza Back, Kathryn Nesbitt, and Karen Díaz Medina. Frappart then officially became the first-ever female referee to officiate a World Cup match when she worked the [Costa Rica vs Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E#Costa_Rica_vs_Germany "2022 FIFA World Cup Group E") match in [Group E](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E "2022 FIFA World Cup Group E") on 1 December.[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-129)

Gambian referee [Bakary Gassama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bakary_Gassama "Bakary Gassama") and Argentine assistant referee Juan Pablo Belatti were among the officials to serve at their third World Cup. Belatti was an assistant referee in the [2018 final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "2018 FIFA World Cup Final").[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-130)[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-131)[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-132) Other returning officials included referees [César Arturo Ramos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Arturo_Ramos "César Arturo Ramos") of Mexico and [Janny Sikazwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janny_Sikazwe "Janny Sikazwe") of Zambia, and Iranian assistant referee [Mohammadreza Mansouri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammadreza_Mansouri "Mohammadreza Mansouri").[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-133)[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-134)[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-135)

On 15 December 2022, FIFA announced that [Polish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_Football_Association "Polish Football Association") referee [Szymon Marciniak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szymon_Marciniak "Szymon Marciniak") would adjudicate the final.[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-136)

triples.statement: Stéphanie Frappart had previously officiated the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup Final.

triples.statement: On December 15, 2022, FIFA announced that Polish referee Szymon Marciniak would officiate the final.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_opening_ceremony "2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony")

The [opening ceremony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_opening_ceremony "2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony") took place on Sunday, 20 November 2022 at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor, prior to the [opening match of the tournament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A#Qatar_vs_Ecuador "2022 FIFA World Cup Group A") between hosts Qatar and Ecuador.[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-137) It included appearances by [Morgan Freeman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morgan_Freeman "Morgan Freeman") and [Ghanim Al-Muftah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghanim_Al-Muftah "Ghanim Al-Muftah"), along with performances by South Korean singer and [BTS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BTS "BTS") member [Jungkook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jungkook "Jungkook") and Qatari singer [Fahad Al Kubaisi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fahad_Al_Kubaisi "Fahad Al Kubaisi").[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-138)[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-139) It was the first time that the [Qur'an](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quran "Quran") had been recited as part of the opening ceremony.[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-140) During the ceremony, [Emir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emir_of_Qatar "Emir of Qatar")[Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamim_bin_Hamad_Al_Thani "Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani") declared the tournament open.[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-141)

triples.statement: The opening ceremony was held on Sunday, November 20, 2022, at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor, before the opening match between Qatar and Ecuador.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_B "2022 FIFA World Cup Group B")

England completed a 6–2 victory over Iran. Iranian keeper [Alireza Beiranvand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alireza_Beiranvand "Alireza Beiranvand") was removed from the game for a suspected [concussion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Concussion "Concussion") before England scored three first-half goals.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-EngIrn-156)[Mehdi Taremi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mehdi_Taremi "Mehdi Taremi") scored in the second half after which England defender [Harry Maguire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Maguire "Harry Maguire") was also removed for a concussion.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-EngIrn-156)[Timothy Weah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Weah "Timothy Weah"), of the United States, scored a first-half goal against Wales; however, the match finished as a draw after a penalty kick was won and scored by [Gareth Bale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gareth_Bale "Gareth Bale").[[152]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-157) Iran defeated Wales 2–0 following a red card to Welsh goalkeeper [Wayne Hennessey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Hennessey "Wayne Hennessey") after he committed a foul outside of his [penalty area](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_area "Penalty area"). Substitute [Rouzbeh Cheshmi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rouzbeh_Cheshmi "Rouzbeh Cheshmi") scored the first goal eight minutes into stoppage time, followed by [Ramin Rezaeian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramin_Rezaeian "Ramin Rezaeian") scoring three minutes later.[[153]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-158) England and the United States played to a 0–0 draw, with only four shots on target between them, and one shot from Christian Pulisic hit the crossbar.[[154]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-159) England won the group following a 3–0 win over Wales with a goal by [Phil Foden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phil_Foden "Phil Foden") and two by [Marcus Rashford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcus_Rashford "Marcus Rashford").[[155]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-160) With the United States needing no less than a win to advance, [Christian Pulisic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Pulisic "Christian Pulisic") scored the winning goal while colliding with the opposing goalkeeper as the United States defeated Iran 1–0 to qualify for the round of 16.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-161)

[![Image 220](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_34%2C_Iran_v_United_States_-_01.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_34%2C_Iran_v_United_States_-_01.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_34,_Iran_v_United_States_-_01.jpg)

triples.sentence: [Timothy Weah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Weah "Timothy Weah"), of the United States, scored a first-half goal against Wales; however, the match finished as a draw after a penalty kick was won and scored by [Gareth Bale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gareth_Bale "Gareth Bale").[[152]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-157)
triples.statement: The United States' match against Wales ended in a draw, with Timothy Weah scoring in the first half and Gareth Bale equalizing with a penalty kick.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D")

The match between Denmark and Tunisia ended as a goalless draw; both teams had goals disallowed by offside calls.[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-SKYDenTun-172) Danish midfielder [Christian Eriksen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Eriksen "Christian Eriksen") made his first major international appearance since suffering a cardiac arrest at the [UEFA Euro 2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020 "UEFA Euro 2020").[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-SKYDenTun-172) Defending champions France went a goal behind to Australia, after a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") goal within ten minutes. France, however, scored four goals, by [Adrien Rabiot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrien_Rabiot "Adrien Rabiot"), [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") and two by [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") to win 4–1.[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-GuardianFraAus-173) The goals tied Giroud with [Thierry Henry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thierry_Henry "Thierry Henry") as France's all-time top goalscorer.[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-GuardianFraAus-173)[Mitchell Duke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitchell_Duke "Mitchell Duke") scored the only goal as Australia won against Tunisia. This was their first World Cup win since 2010.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto4-174)[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-175) Mbappé scored a brace as France defeated Denmark 2–1. This was enough for France to qualify for the knockout round—the first time since Brazil in 2006 that the defending champions progressed through the opening round.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto4-174)[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-176)[Mathew Leckie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathew_Leckie "Mathew Leckie") scored the only goal as Australia defeated Denmark 1–0, qualifying for the knockout round as runners-up with the win.[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-177)[Wahbi Khazri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wahbi_Khazri "Wahbi Khazri") scored for Tunisia against France in the 58th minute. Although [Antoine Griezmann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoine_Griezmann "Antoine Griezmann") equalised in stoppage time it was overturned for offside. Tunisia finished third in the group, as they required a draw in the Denmark and Australia game.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-178)

[![Image 279](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%2811%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%2811%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_(11).jpg)

triples.sentence: This was enough for France to qualify for the knockout round—the first time since Brazil in 2006 that the defending champions progressed through the opening round.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto4-174)[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-176)
triples.statement: France's victory secured their qualification for the knockout round, making them the first defending champions to advance from the group stage since Brazil in 2006.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group E](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E "2022 FIFA World Cup Group E")

Group E began with Japan facing [2014 champions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup "2014 FIFA World Cup") Germany. After an early penalty kick was converted by Germany's [İlkay Gündoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C4%B0lkay_G%C3%BCndo%C4%9Fan "İlkay Gündoğan"), Japan scored two second-half goals by [Ritsu Dōan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsu_D%C5%8Dan "Ritsu Dōan") and [Takuma Asano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takuma_Asano "Takuma Asano") in a 2–1 win.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-179) In the second group match, Spain defeated Costa Rica 7–0. First-half goals by [Dani Olmo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dani_Olmo "Dani Olmo"), [Marco Asensio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marco_Asensio "Marco Asensio"), and [Ferran Torres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferran_Torres "Ferran Torres") were followed by goals by [Gavi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavi_(footballer) "Gavi (footballer)"), [Carlos Soler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Soler_(footballer) "Carlos Soler (footballer)"), [Alvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alvaro_Morata "Alvaro Morata"), and a second by Torres.[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-180)[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-181) This was the largest defeat in a World Cup since Portugal's victory over North Korea in the [2010 event](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup") by the same scoreline.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-182) Costa Rica defeated Japan 1–0, with [Keysher Fuller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keysher_Fuller "Keysher Fuller") scoring with Costa Rica's first shot on target of the tournament.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-183) Germany and Spain drew 1–1, with [Álvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Morata "Álvaro Morata") scoring for Spain and [Niclas Füllkrug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niclas_F%C3%BCllkrug "Niclas Füllkrug") scoring for Germany.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-184)[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-185)[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-186) Morata scored the opening goal for Spain against Japan as they controlled the first half of the match.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:10-187) Japan equalised on [Ritsu Doan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsu_Doan "Ritsu Doan") before a second goal by [Ao Tanaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ao_Tanaka "Ao Tanaka") was heavily investigated by VAR for the ball potentially being out of play.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Bunshun.jp_interview_Josek-188) The goal was awarded, and Japan won the group following a 2–1 win. Disputes over the VAR's call was only settled when the [Associated Press](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press") released an iconic [bird's eye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird%27s_eye_view "Bird's eye view") photo of the ball after the match.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Bunshun.jp_interview_Josek-188)[Serge Gnabry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serge_Gnabry "Serge Gnabry") scored on ten minutes for Germany against Costa Rica and they led until half-time. Germany required a win, and for Japan to not win their match, or for both teams to win their matches by a combined goal difference of at least 9 goals, to qualify. In the second half, goals by [Yeltsin Tejeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yeltsin_Tejeda "Yeltsin Tejeda") and [Juan Vargas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Pablo_Vargas "Juan Pablo Vargas") gave Costa Rica a 2–1 lead, which would have qualified them into the knockout stages ahead of Spain. Germany scored three further goals—two by [Kai Havertz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kai_Havertz "Kai Havertz") and a goal by [Niclas Fullkrug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niclas_Fullkrug "Niclas Fullkrug"), ending in a 4–2 win for Germany—which was not enough to qualify them for the final stages. This was the second time in a row that the four-time champions failed to progress past the group stages.[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-189) Japan won the group ahead of Spain.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-190)

[![Image 305](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Germany_1%E2%80%932_Japan_-_%284%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Germany_1%E2%80%932_Japan_-_%284%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Germany_1%E2%80%932_Japan_-_(4).jpg)

triples.statement: Japan equalized through Ritsu Doan, and a second goal by Ao Tanaka was awarded after a lengthy VAR review to determine if the ball had gone out of play.

triples.sentence: Disputes over the VAR's call was only settled when the [Associated Press](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press") released an iconic [bird's eye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird%27s_eye_view "Bird's eye view") photo of the ball after the match.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Bunshun.jp_interview_Josek-188)
triples.statement: Controversy over the VAR decision was resolved after the Associated Press published a bird's eye view photograph of the ball.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_F "2022 FIFA World Cup Group F")

Group F's first match was a goalless draw between Morocco and Croatia.[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-191) Canada had a penalty kick in the first half of their match against Belgium which was saved by [Thibaut Courtois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois"). Belgium won the match by a single goal by [Michy Batshuayi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michy_Batshuayi "Michy Batshuayi").[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-192)[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-193) Belgium lost 2–0 to Morocco, despite Morocco having a long-range [direct free kick goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_kick_(association_football) "Free kick (association football)") by [Hakim Ziyech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakim_Ziyech "Hakim Ziyech") overturned for an offside on another player in the lead up to the goal. Two second-half goals from [Zakaria Aboukhlal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zakaria_Aboukhlal "Zakaria Aboukhlal") and [Romain Saïss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romain_Sa%C3%AFss "Romain Saïss") helped the Morocco win their first World Cup match since 1998.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-194)[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-195) The match sparked riots in Belgium, with fires and fireworks being set off by residents.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-196)[Alphonso Davies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphonso_Davies "Alphonso Davies") scored Canada's first World Cup goal to give Canada the lead over Croatia. Goals by [Marko Livaja](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marko_Livaja "Marko Livaja"), [Lovro Majer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovro_Majer "Lovro Majer"), and two by [Andrej Kramarić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrej_Kramari%C4%87 "Andrej Kramarić") for Croatia completed a 4–1 victory.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-197) Morocco scored two early goals through [Hakim Ziyech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakim_Ziyech "Hakim Ziyech") and [Youssef En-Nesyri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssef_En-Nesyri "Youssef En-Nesyri") in their game against Canada and qualified following a 2–1 victory. Canada's only goal was an [own goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Own_goal "Own goal") by [Nayef Aguerd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nayef_Aguerd "Nayef Aguerd").[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-198) Croatia and Belgium played a goalless draw which eliminated Belgium, whose team was ranked second in the world, from the tournament.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-199)

triples.sentence: Belgium won the match by a single goal by [Michy Batshuayi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michy_Batshuayi "Michy Batshuayi").[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-192)[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-193)
triples.statement: Belgium won their match against Canada with a single goal scored by Michy Batshuayi.

section_body:
The round of 16 was played from 3 to 7 December,[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) which for the first time ever included teams from [the Americas and four other continents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number "Continent").[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-218) Group A winners Netherlands scored goals through [Memphis Depay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis_Depay "Memphis Depay"), [Daley Blind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daley_Blind "Daley Blind"), and [Denzel Dumfries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denzel_Dumfries "Denzel Dumfries") as they defeated the United States 3–1, with [Haji Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haji_Wright "Haji Wright") scoring for the United States.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-219) Messi scored his third of the tournament alongside [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") to give Argentina a two-goal lead over Australia, and despite an Enzo Fernández own goal from a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") shot, Argentina won 2–1.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-220)[Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud")'s goal and Mbappé's brace enabled France to have a 3–1 victory over Poland, with [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski") scoring the lone goal for Poland from a penalty.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-221) England beat Senegal 3–0, with goals coming from [Jordan Henderson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan_Henderson "Jordan Henderson"), [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane"), and [Bukayo Saka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukayo_Saka "Bukayo Saka").[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-222)[Daizen Maeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daizen_Maeda "Daizen Maeda") scored for Japan against Croatia in the first half before a leveller from [Ivan Perišić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Peri%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Ivan Perišić") in the second. Neither team could find the winner, with Croatia defeating Japan 3–1 in a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)").[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-223)[Vinícius Júnior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin%C3%ADcius_J%C3%BAnior "Vinícius Júnior"), [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar"), [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison"), and [Lucas Paquetá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucas_Paquet%C3%A1 "Lucas Paquetá") all scored for Brazil, but a volley from South Korean [Paik Seung-ho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paik_Seung-ho "Paik Seung-ho") reduced the deficit to 4–1.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-224)[Pablo Sarabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Sarabia "Pablo Sarabia") had the best chance for Spain to break the deadlock against Morocco in stoppage time after two goalless hours, but he hit the goalie's right-hand post after a shot from the left; Morocco won the match 3–0 on penalties.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-225) A [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") by [Gonçalo Ramos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gon%C3%A7alo_Ramos "Gonçalo Ramos") led Portugal to defeat Switzerland 6–1, with goals from Portugal's [Pepe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepe_(footballer,_born_1983) "Pepe (footballer, born 1983)"), [Raphaël Guerreiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapha%C3%ABl_Guerreiro "Raphaël Guerreiro"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") and from Switzerland's [Manuel Akanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Akanji "Manuel Akanji").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-226)

triples.sentence: The round of 16 was played from 3 to 7 December,[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) which for the first time ever included teams from [the Americas and four other continents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number "Continent").[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-218)
triples.statement: The Round of 16 was held from December 3 to 7 and, for the first time, featured teams from the Americas and four other continents.

triples.sentence: [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud")'s goal and Mbappé's brace enabled France to have a 3–1 victory over Poland, with [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski") scoring the lone goal for Poland from a penalty.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-221)
triples.statement: France defeated Poland 3–1, with a goal from Olivier Giroud and two from Mbappé, while Robert Lewandowski scored Poland's only goal via a penalty.

triples.sentence: England beat Senegal 3–0, with goals coming from [Jordan Henderson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan_Henderson "Jordan Henderson"), [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane"), and [Bukayo Saka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukayo_Saka "Bukayo Saka").[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-222)
triples.statement: England defeated Senegal 3–0 with goals from Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane, and Bukayo Saka.

section_body:
The quarter-finals were played on 9 and 10 December.[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) Croatia and Brazil ended 0–0 after 90 minutes and went to extra time. Neymar scored for Brazil in the 15th minute of extra time. Croatia, however, equalised through [Bruno Petković](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Petkovi%C4%87 "Bruno Petković") in the second period of extra time. With the match tied, a penalty shootout decided the contest, with Croatia winning the shootout 4–2.[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-227)[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-228) In the second quarter-final match, [Nahuel Molina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nahuel_Molina "Nahuel Molina") and Messi scored for Argentina before [Wout Weghorst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wout_Weghorst "Wout Weghorst") equalised with two goals shortly before the end of the game. The match went to extra time and then penalties, where Argentina would go on to win 4–3.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-229) Morocco defeated Portugal 1–0, with [Youssef En-Nesyri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssef_En-Nesyri "Youssef En-Nesyri") scoring at the end of the first half. Morocco became the first African and the first Arab nation to advance as far as the semi-finals of the competition.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-230) Despite [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane") scoring a penalty for England, it was not enough to beat France, who won 2–1 by virtue of goals from [Aurélien Tchouaméni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lien_Tchouam%C3%A9ni "Aurélien Tchouaméni") and [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") and a late missed penalty by Kane, sending them to their second consecutive World Cup semi-final and becoming the first defending champions to reach this stage since Brazil in 1998.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-231)[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-232)

triples.sentence: The quarter-finals were played on 9 and 10 December.[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35)
triples.statement: The quarter-finals were played on 9 and 10 December.

triples.sentence: Despite [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane") scoring a penalty for England, it was not enough to beat France, who won 2–1 by virtue of goals from [Aurélien Tchouaméni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lien_Tchouam%C3%A9ni "Aurélien Tchouaméni") and [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") and a late missed penalty by Kane, sending them to their second consecutive World Cup semi-final and becoming the first defending champions to reach this stage since Brazil in 1998.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-231)[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-232)
triples.statement: France defeated England 2-1, with goals from Aurélien Tchouaméni and Olivier Giroud, to reach their second consecutive World Cup semi-final, becoming the first defending champions to reach this stage since Brazil in 1998.

section_body:
The semi-finals were played on 13 and 14 December.[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) Messi scored a penalty kick before [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") scored twice to give Argentina a 3–0 victory over Croatia.[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-233)[Théo Hernandez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") scored after five minutes as France led Morocco for most of the game. [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") scored in the 78th minute to complete a 2–0 victory for France over Morocco as they reached their second consecutive final.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-234)

section_body:
[![Image 738](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg/250px-Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)

Argentina captain and forward [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the [Golden Ball award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball"), becoming the first player to win it twice.

The following [World Cup awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards "FIFA World Cup awards") were given at the conclusion of the tournament: the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") (top scorer), [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") (best overall player) and [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") (best goalkeeper).[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-253)

| [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") | Silver Ball | Bronze Ball |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [![Image 739: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") | [![Image 740: France national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")[Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") | [![Image 741: Croatia national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Croatia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Croatia.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team")[Luka Modrić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić") |
| [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") | Silver Boot | Bronze Boot |
| [![Image 742: France national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")[Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") * * * 8 goals, 2 assists | [![Image 743: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") * * * 7 goals, 3 assists | [![Image 744: France national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")[Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") * * * 4 goals, 0 assists |
| [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") |
| [![Image 745: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Emiliano Martínez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") |
| [FIFA Young Player Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Young_Player_Award "FIFA World Cup Young Player Award") |
| [![Image 746: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") |
| [FIFA Fair Play Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Fair_Play_Trophy "FIFA World Cup Fair Play Trophy") |
| ![Image 747](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/40px-Flag_of_England.svg.png)[England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") |

Additionally, FIFA.com shortlisted 10 goals for users to vote on as the tournament's best. The award was won by Brazil's [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") for his second goal in the [group stage match against Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G#Brazil_vs_Serbia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group G").[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-254)

triples.sentence: The following [World Cup awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards "FIFA World Cup awards") were given at the conclusion of the tournament: the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") (top scorer), [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") (best overall player) and [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") (best goalkeeper).[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-253)
triples.statement: The World Cup awards given at the conclusion of the tournament included the Golden Boot (top scorer), Golden Ball (best overall player), and Golden Glove (best goalkeeper).

[![Image 748](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/A7-BEB_-_Qatar_Airways_%28FIFA_World_Cup_2022_Livery%29_-_Boeing_777-3DZER_-_43215_-_VGHS.jpg/250px-A7-BEB_-_Qatar_Airways_%28FIFA_World_Cup_2022_Livery%29_-_Boeing_777-3DZER_-_43215_-_VGHS.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:A7-BEB_-_Qatar_Airways_(FIFA_World_Cup_2022_Livery)_-_Boeing_777-3DZER_-_43215_-_VGHS.jpg)

[Qatar Airways](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_Airways "Qatar Airways") was one of the [sponsors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sponsor_(commercial) "Sponsor (commercial)") of FIFA World Cup 2022.

The sponsors of the 2022 World Cup are divided into seven categories: FIFA Partners, FIFA World Cup Sponsors and African and Middle Eastern, Asian, European, North American and South American supporters. This marks the first time a FIFA World Cup is sponsored by supporters from seven different regions.

section_body:
Main article: [Adidas Al Rihla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Al_Rihla "Adidas Al Rihla")

[![Image 749](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Al-Rihla_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Al-Rihla_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Al-Rihla_(cropped).jpg)

Adidas Al Rihla

[![Image 750](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Predio_Deportivo_Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_BugWarp_04_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Predio_Deportivo_Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_BugWarp_04_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Predio_Deportivo_Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_BugWarp_04_(cropped).jpg)

Adidas Al Hilm

The first official match ball, "[Adidas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas "Adidas") Al Rihla", was unveiled on 30 March 2022. It was mainly inspired by the culture, architecture, iconic boats and flag of Qatar. In Arabic, the word _Al-Rihla_ (الْرِّحْلَة _ar-riḥla_) means "the journey". The ball was designed with sustainability as a priority, making it the first-ever official match ball created with water-based glues and inks. As "the game is getting faster" and "speeds up", the ball has internal electronic sensors, allowing detection of its speed and position, updated 500 times per second[[295]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-300) and it has to be charged before each game.[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-301) Two of the match balls were sent and returned from space by FIFA and [Qatar Airways](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_Airways "Qatar Airways") on a [SpaceX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SpaceX "SpaceX")[falcon 9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Falcon_9 "Falcon 9")[suborbital mission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sub-orbital_spaceflight "Sub-orbital spaceflight") for promoting the World Cup.[[297]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-302)

The match ball for the semi-finals, third place play-off and [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2022 FIFA World Cup final") was announced on 11 December 2022. It is a variation of the Al Rihla named the "Adidas Al Hilm _"_ ([Arabic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabic_language "Arabic language"): الحلم, [romanised](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanization_of_Arabic "Romanization of Arabic"):_al-ḥulm_, [lit.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Literal_translation "Literal translation")''the dream'', a reference to "every nation's dream of lifting the FIFA World Cup").[[298]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-303) While the technical aspects of the ball are the same, the colour is different from the Al Rihla balls used in the group stages and preceding knockout games, with a _Gold Metallic_, maroon, _Collegiate Burgundy_, and red design,[[299]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-304) a reference to the [national colours](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Qatar "Flag of Qatar") of host nation [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar "Qatar") and the golden colours shared by the Final's [venue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium") and the [FIFA World Cup Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Trophy "FIFA World Cup Trophy").[[300]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-2022-03-30-fifa-305)
